description.html:
A ring with a large rare blue jewel. The stone is said to be a tear of sorrow of an old goddess on her deathbed, for tears are always more beautiful near death.

When your hit points drop below half, you gain resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage. These resistances fade when returning above half your hit points.

A ring with a large rare red jewel. The stone is said to be a tear of anger of an old goddess on her deathbed, for tears always show more emotion near death.

When your hit points drop below half, you gain +2 to all attack rolls, and damage rolls for your weapons and spells. These bonuses fade when returning above half your hit points.

A once great king of legend was said to be lined with steel, for such that even the talons of dragons could not harm him.

Your AC becomes increased by +2 while attuned to this ring.

A ring with a small red jewel encased in a black band.

Your Constitution score is 19 while you wear this ring. It has no effect on you if your Constitution score is already 19 or higher without it.

'Pew Pew' says the adventurer, only next for his enemy to have an explosion right in his face.

Must say 'Pew Pew' for the ring to activate, the louder the words are said, the more damage it does. (GM's discretion.)

Putting on the Ring of Finger Guns allows you to shoot one dart of a Magic Missile from your fingers, dealing 1d4+1 force damage (minimum) to a creature within 120 feet. You can shoot a magic dart as either an action or bonus action. The Ring of Finger Guns contains three charges for magic darts, and those charges are regained at midnight.

Somebody once told me they'd give an arm and a leg to have this ring. That doesn't seem like they're losing very much does it?

While wearing this ring, you regain 1d6 Hit Points every 10 minutes, provided that you have at least 1 hit point. If you lose a body part, the ring causes the missing part to regrow and return to full fuctionality after 1d6+1 days if you have at least 1 hit point the whole time.

This ring guarantees Acrobatics proficiency if the person does not have it. The user's movement speed increases by 10 feet, can jump twice as high, and also has advantage when rolling Acrobatics of Stealth (Dexterity) checks.

This ring has been infused with radiant energy from a god.

While attuned to this ring, you are resistant to radiant damage and deal 1d6 radiant damage with your melee attacks.

Fiends and undead are unable to regenerate for one round after taking radiant damage this way.
